question: who is the young man in hawthorne's my kinsman major molineux
vanilla_rag_result: In Nathaniel Hawthorne's "My Kinsman, Major Molineux," the young man is Robin, a young and naive protagonist who arrives in a colonial town in search of his kinsman, Major Molineux. Throughout the story, Robin's journey serves as a coming-of-age experience as he navigates the complexities of the town and ultimately witnesses the downfall of his kinsman, which symbolizes a broader commentary on the changing social and political landscape of the time.
